JavaScript for Automation (JXA) support: JavaScript for Automation (JXA) support in Nova.
jxa.msg.activation-error: There was an error activating the JXA extension. Please check the extension console for errors.
jxa.msg.eslint-removal: The built-in ESLint functionality has been removed from the JXA extension. The µESLint extension provides a working alternative for linting JXA files.
jxa.opts.linting.title: Linting
jxa.opts.linting.description: Open JXA files can be lintzed using OSACompile. This will only report critical errors; real linters, e.g. ESLint, will produce far more useful output.
jxa.cmd.file2editor.title: Open file in Script Editor…
jxa.cmd.selection2editor.title: Send selection to Script Editor…
jxa.cmd.workspace-config.title: JXA Workspace preferences…
jxa.build.task.title: Compile JXA Script
jxa.build.task.description: Compiles the current JavaScript for Automation (JXA) source file to a binary JXA script.
jxa.build.directory.title: Build directory
jxa.build.directory.description: The directory where to put the compiled scripts, relative to the project root.
jxa.build.options.title: Output format settings
jxa.build.options.description: The following options dictate what kind of script will be created.
jxa.build.format.title: Script file format
jxa.build.format.description: The script format to compile to.
jxa.build.format.scpt.title: Compiled script file (.scpt)
jxa.build.format.scptd.title: Compiled script bundle (.scptd)
jxa.build.format.app.title: Applet or Droplet (.app)
jxa.build.keep-extension.title: Do not strip the original file extension
jxa.build.keep-extension.description: By default, the compiled file format extension will replace the original file extension (e.g. “file.js” becomes “file.scpt”). Check this if you want it to be appended instead (e.g. “file.js” becomes “file.js.scpt”).
jxa.build.execute-only.title: Save the resulting script as execute-only
jxa.build.execute-only.description: Compile the script for execution only: the source code will not be available for editing in the compiled file.
jxa.build.applet.title: Applet / Droplet settings
jxa.build.applet.description: The following options are only relevant when creating a new bundled applet or droplet.
jxa.build.applet.stay-open.title: Stay-open applet
jxa.build.applet.splash-screen.title: Use startup screen
jxa.run.task.title: Execute JXA script
jxa.run.task.description: Execute the current JavaScript for Automation (JXA) source code.
jxa.run.selected.title: Run selection
jxa.run.selected.description: Run the code of the primary selection in the editor. If this is unset, or if this is set and no code is selected, the whole source file will be run.
jxa.run.readable-output.title: Human readable output
jxa.run.readable-output.description: Printing results in human-readable form means strings do not have quotes around them, characters are not escaped, brackets for arrays and braces for objects are omitted, etc. Apple consider this as “generally more useful”, but it can introduce ambiguities. To see the results in an unambiguous form that could be recompiled into the same value, switch this off.
